title: Johnny Sexton's importance to Ireland cannot be overstated as Joe Schmidt’s side head into knockout stages
text:
Given the devastation being wrought by Typhoon Hagibis a few hundred miles away, it felt slightly surreal to be playing any rugby at all in Fukuoka.

Ireland, therefore, are to be commended for focusing on the job in hand and getting the bonus-point win they needed to guarantee themselves a quarter-final berth next weekend.

This match had the potential to be a banana skin, with a pitch which was literally coming apart at the seams and a charged-up Samoan team thirsting for Irish blood.

But it was Samoa who lost their way. The Pacific Islanders will feel hard done by some of the refereeing decisions, but they started poorly, giving away far too many penalties, and failed to capitalise even after...
description: Given the devastation being wrought by Typhoon Hagibis a few hundred miles away, it felt slightly surreal to be playing any rugby at all in Fukuoka.
